availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fayette County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Norton Bruce. Father of Elizabeth "Lizzie" Bruce, John T. Bruce, and Charlotte Bruce. Physician in Fayette County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned seven enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Physician in Lexington in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 140A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District 1, p. 521.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, p. 426.
Find A Grave, "Dr James Morrison Bruce (1822-1881)," Memorial #100465277, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/100465277 (accessed June 1, 2021).
